pull.title: [bugfix] [wallet] Fix zapwallettxes/multiwallet interaction.
pull.body:
`-zapwallettxes` should be disallowed when starting bitcoin in multiwallet mode.

There's code in `WalletInit::ParameterInteraction()` to disallow `-zapwallettxes` when running in multiwallet mode. This code functioned as expected when passing the parameter `-zapwallettxes=1`, but not when passing the parameter `-zapwallettxes` (ie without the value specified). Fix that and add a test.

The new test in the 
_[wallet] [tests] Test disallowed multiwallet params_ commit reproduces the bug and should fail against master.

Fixes #12505

events.message:
[wallet] Fix zapwallettxes/multiwallet interaction.

-zapwallettxes should be disallowed when starting bitcoin in multiwallet
mode.

[wallet] [tests] Test disallowed multiwallet params

Add a test to check that bitcoind fails to start when specifying
-zapwallettxes, -salvagewallet and -upgradewallet when running in
multiwallet mode.

issue.title: Bad interaction of -zapwallettxes and pruning / multiwallet
issue.body:
After some googling, I recently ran `bitcoin-qt -zapwallettxes` on a 0.15.1 pruned multiwallet node in order to remove a stuck transaction from the transaction list, without fully understanding what I was doing. After running the command and realizing what I'd done, I was surprised to learn
1. The operation succeeded without warning despite the fact I was running a multiwallet configuration
2. The operation succeeded without warning even though I was running a pruned node. Meaning I now had to re-download and verify the full blockchain to get my wallets' transactions back
3. The software made no wallet backups despite the destructive nature of the operation

After some poking around in the code a bit it appears there are safeguards against 1 and 2, but they didn't trigger in this case. Maybe because my pruning and wallet options were being set via bitcoin.conf instead of the command line?

events.body: utACK 1f83839 (`GetBoolArg` is also used later on in `CreateWalletFromFile`)

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
Add logging and error handling for file syncing
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13039

Consistently log CValidationState on call failure
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13020

test: Add rpc_bind test to default-run tests
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12510

trivial: Fix relevent typo
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13052

[doc] Add comments for chainparams.h, validation.cpp
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13012

Interrupt block generation on shutdown request
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12448

[bugfix] [wallet] Fix zapwallettxes/multiwallet interaction.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13030

qt: Show the Window when double clicking the taskbar icon
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12999

Reduce implementation code inside CScript
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12885

qt: Don't log to console by default
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13055

List support for BIP173 in bips.md
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13064

issue.title: [0.16] Further Backports
issue.body:
Backports:
- #13201 [qa] Handle disconnect_node race
- #13184 RPC Docs: gettxout*: clarify bestblock and unspent counts

- #12988 Hold cs_main while calling UpdatedBlockTip() signal

to the 0.16 branch.
